;美国佐治亚州周一似乎将向唐纳德·特朗普提出各种指控根据富尔顿县法院网站上发布的两页纸的案卷报告，亚特兰大检察官一直在调查特朗普及其盟友是否非法干预 2020 年的总统大选。佐治亚州选举开始向大陪审团陈述案件。

;

;对这位美国前总统的指控包括要求公职人员宣誓；串谋伪造；并违反了州 Rico（敲诈勒索影响和腐败组织）法。

;

;被传唤在大陪审团面前作证的前民主党州参议员 Jen Jordan 于晚些时候离开富尔顿县法院时说道周一早上，她受到了大约 40 分钟的讯问。

;

;新闻媒体报道称，前民主党州议员 Bee Nguyen 和国务卿办公室高级官员加布里埃尔·斯特林 (Gabriel Sterling) 早些时候抵达法院两年半以来，富尔顿县地方检察官法尼·威利斯一直在调查特朗普和其他人为推翻他在佐治亚州以微弱优势输给民主党人乔·拜登而采取的行动。

;

; p>;

;亚特兰大市中心法院周围的障碍和街道封闭，以及威利斯的声明，都表明向大陪审团的陈述可能于本周开始。

;

;特朗普突然介入爱荷华博览会扰乱德桑蒂斯重启竞选活动的努力

;

;阮和乔丹均出席了 2020 年 12 月的立法听证会，听证会上前纽约市长和特朗普律师鲁迪·朱利安尼等人对佐治亚州普遍存在的选举舞弊提出了虚假指控。

;

;特朗普律师约翰·伊士曼也至少出席了其中一次听证会，并表示选举的举行不符合佐治亚州法律，立法者应任命新的选举人名单。

;

;斯特林和他的老板、佐治亚州国务卿布拉德·拉芬斯佩格（均为共和党人）强烈反驳了有关佐治亚州选举普遍存在问题的指控。

;

;现在美国司法部长梅里克·加兰已任命一名特别检察官来调查金融交易对于乔·拜登总统的儿子亨特·拜登来说，我们应该会看到小拜登与中国公司交易的细节重新成为头条新闻。

;

;从 2017 年开始，在大约 14 个月的时间里，上海-总部位于能源集团华信能源及其高管向亨特·拜登控制或与亨特·拜登有某种联系的实体支付了 480 万美元。这些细节，以及与总统的儿子在拜登担任副总统期间担任乌克兰能源公司 Burisma 董事会成员有关的细节，已公开多年。

;

;2020 年，参议院共和党人提出了广泛的意见关于他们的报告，其中强调了他们所谓的“拜登家族和中国公民之间的庞大企业联系和金融交易网络”。

;

;这些付款和拜登生活的所有其他细节也被挑选出来由前总统唐纳德·特朗普任命的联邦检察官大卫·韦斯 (David Weiss) 执掌了五年多的时间。在上个月与亨特·拜登的认罪协议破裂后，加兰任命韦斯领导新的调查。

;

;鉴于近年来美国人对中国的怀疑有多么严重，并已成为一个令人担忧的问题。对于两党立法者来说，最重要的原因是，他在该国的交易似乎不可避免地会成为一个爆炸性的故事。但他们没有这样做，并不是因为 — — 正如一些共和党人所坚称的 — — 美国主流媒体正在密谋保护拜登家族。

;

;以权谋私与政治一样古老。如果特朗普任命的检察官无法在亨特·拜登对这些古老做法的尝试中找到任何违反法律的地方，那么此事就永远不会成为公众关注的焦点。

;

;如果韦斯的调查是一项新的调查，任命的特别检察官导致指控亨特·拜登通过接近美国行政权力非法获利，那么他就犯有特朗普自己的女儿和女婿似乎参与的活动。

;

;我们应该相信，特朗普卸任六个月后，沙特政府向贾里德·库什纳的投资公司投资了 20 亿美元，这与库什纳多次乘坐空军一号前往利雅得无关？

;

;什么是库什纳作为金融家的职业生涯将迫使沙特政府让他成为沙特王国部分财富的管家？随着特朗普治下的美国与沙特关系的改善，是否有任何令人信服的因素足以消除对政治交换条件的怀疑？

;

;伊万卡·特朗普和贾里德·库什纳如何在没有白宫薪水的情况下赚取数百万美元

;

;在没有任何灵活的财务头脑的例子的情况下，我们得出的结论是，他与沙特王室建立的关系有助于将业务带到库什纳的公司。那么，中国商标局在伊万卡·特朗普·马克公司 (Ivanka Trump Marks LLC) 父亲在任期间授予她数十个商标，这又是怎么回事呢？

;

;如果有的话，我们必须想知道亨特·拜登是如何只赚到了几百万美元的 –那些年中美投资流动的宏伟计划甚至连一个四舍五入的误差都没有——来自他的中国商业利益。随着中国经济的蓬勃发展，并有望超越美国，所有参与国际业务的人都希望能从业务中分得一杯羹。在任何其他情况下，特朗普都会嘲笑如此微薄的回报。

;

;这并不是说，如果法院认定亨特·拜登的活动超出了法律界限，他们的活动就应该不受惩罚。如果我们最终要追捕那些进行影响力交易的政府官员的家人，我们就需要从某个地方开始。

;

;除非亨特·拜登与中国的交易或他的其他事务中出现了新的、特别可恶的事情。韦斯的调查显示，这只会对拜登有利。尤其如此，因为特朗普和他的家人不能辩称他们没有利用前总统的政治影响力来获取经济利益。

;

;现在韦斯已被提升为特别检察官，我们将更清楚地了解这一情况。对现任总统之子不利的证据。这将使我们更容易将这一活动与库什纳和伊万卡·特朗普的活动进行比较。

;

;如果美国开始起诉出售白宫影响力以获取经济利益，那么他们迟早会这样做。处于法律的聚光灯下。

;日本战时​​首相东条英机等甲级战将遗骸火化最近发现的美国解密文件显示，罪犯被秘密分散在海洋中，以防止他们被日本人民神化。

;

;这些文件首次正式确认了美国军方 1948 年决定背后的原因，出于对二战战败后日本“超民族精神”可能复兴的担忧。

;

;类似于在 1945-1946 年纽伦堡审判中被定罪的纳粹德国战犯遗骸的分散方式其中一份文件指出，“对被处决的（日本）战犯遗体的最终处置应永远消除他们成为英雄或烈士的祭祀对象的可能性”。

;

;共同社从美国国家档案和记录管理局获得的解密文件是道格拉斯·麦克阿瑟将军领导下的美国远东司令部于 1948 年 4 月东京战争罪行法庭得出结论后撰写的。

;

;在一份 1948 年 7 月 21 日题为“参谋研究”的文件中，东京远东司令部军需部门的迈克尔·里维斯托少校建议秘密处理被处决战犯的遗骸，以“永远防止他们在任何军事行动中使用”。

;

;该文件由 Rivisto 于 7 月 27 日发送给美国陆军部，请求指示或同意该提议，美国陆军部于8 月 4 日，将此事委托当地单位处理。

;

;里维斯托在 8 月 6 日的一份文件中进一步提出，由于“预日本人在战争中倾向于祭祀那些为天皇献出生命的人，无论其级别如何。”。

;

;

;根据这一建议，麦克阿瑟8 月 13 日决定，将东条等 6 名甲级战犯的骨灰葬于海上，这些人于 11 月被判刑，并于 12 月 23 日在东京巢鸭监狱被处决。

;

;关于遗骸的处理，二战后占领日本的同盟国总司令部外交科科长威廉·塞巴尔德 (William Sebald) 表示：战争期间，他曾在书中写道，火化后的遗骸将被散落，因为他们的坟墓可能被神化。

;

;塞巴尔德也出席了对甲级战犯的处决。

;

;如果罪名成立，巴祖姆可能面临死刑根据尼日尔刑法，处以刑罚。

;军政府发言人阿马杜·阿卜杜拉马内 (Amadou Abdramane) 少校在国家电视台上表示，军政权已“收集必要的证据，向国家和国际主管当局起诉被驱逐的人”。周日晚上的声明称，巴祖姆在政变后与西非高级政治家和“他们的国际导师”进行了交流，其中包括非洲国家领导人。叛乱指控提出虚假指控并试图破坏和平过渡，以证明军事干预的合理性。

;

;该声明没有指明具体的外国国家，也没有具体说明尼日尔民选总统的审判日期。<尽管如此，周一在首都街头，一些居民告诉美联社，他们认为巴祖姆有罪。尼亚美居民阿桑·扎基特 (Assan Zakite) 表示：“他罪有应得，因为这个人背叛了尼日尔，窃取了尼日尔的所有资源。”

;

;

;总统卫队成员于 7 月 26 日驱逐了巴祖姆。此后他一直被软禁，他的妻子和儿子在首都尼亚美的总统府。

;

;尼日尔军政府称法国计划发动袭击以释放巴祖姆，乍得试图调解

;

;军政府面临着释放和释放巴祖姆的国际压力。恢复巴祖姆的职务。政变发生后，西非国家经济共同体（西非经共体）立即要求该政权在 7 天内让他重新掌权，并威胁称，如果不这样做，将使用武力。最后期限到来了，双方都没有采取任何行动。

;

;上周，西非经共体下令部署一支“待命”部队，但尚不清楚该部队何时或是否会进入尼日尔。非洲联盟和平与安全理事会周一召开会议讨论这场危机，如果西非集团认为干预措施威胁到非洲大陆更广泛的和平与安全，则可以否决西非集团的决定。

;China and India began a new round of military-level border talks on Monday, just a week before Chinese President Xi Jinping and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi come face to face in South Africa for the annual Brics summit, and an expected visit to New Delhi by Xi for the Group of 20 summit next month.

;

;The 19th round of military talks is part of continued efforts to ease a three-year stand-off along the “Line of Actual Control (LAC)” – the effective Himalayan border between the two countries – following a deadly clash in May 2020.

;

;The face-off in Galwan Valley, in eastern Ladakh region along the LAC, claimed at least 20 Indian and four Chinese lives in what was their deadliest border encounter in decades.

;

;Despite 18 rounds of talks and four rounds of disengagement, both India and China maintain a significant number of troops and advanced weaponry in eastern Ladakh.

;

;The previous round of negotiations, held in April, had failed to yield any breakthrough and concluded without a joint press statement.

;

;However, an Indian foreign ministry statement later hailed the “frank and in-depth discussion” on restoring “peace and tranquillity in the border areas, which will enable progress in bilateral relations”.

;

;Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, the foreign minister of India, said last week that negotiations had not been halted, and there had been progress on some “very tense” areas in the border dispute.

;

;Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi urged New Delhi to stabilise ties for the benefit of both sides, as he met Jaishankar and Indian national security adviser Ajit Doval on the sidelines of a Brics event in Johannesburg late last month.

;

;Wang and Jaishankar were among officials from Brics nations – which also include Brazil, Russia, and South Africa – who had gathered in the South African financial capital for a series of meetings ahead of the August 22-24 leaders' summit.

;

;He called for policies to “enhance strategic mutual trust” and “focus on consensus and cooperation”, according to a Chinese foreign ministry readout.

;

;China's moves to assert control on border risk further tensions with India

;

;A bilateral meeting between Xi and Modi during next week's summit has not been ruled out, and the Chinese leader is also expected to visit New Delhi for the September 9-10 G20 summit.

;

;Modi and Xi shook hands and exchanged pleasantries when they met on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Bali in November. The Indian foreign ministry disclosed last week that the two leaders had also discussed the need to “stabilise” bilateral ties.

;

;However, Beijing has yet to send an ambassador to Delhi after Sun Weidong's three-year tenure ended in October.

;

;Nonetheless, as the US courts India to counter China's growing influence in the region, New Delhi feels that Beijing has signalled its willingness to make peace at the border.

;

;Indian media outlet News18 quoted “top government sources” in New Delhi as saying that China was “facing a situation with Taiwan and it may not want trouble on two fronts”.

;

;“The dynamics of the increasing closeness between the US and India is also playing a role,” the report cited one of them as saying. “There are some other signals that the Chinese side would want to resolve this.”

;

;Rajiv Dogra, a former Indian diplomat, said it would be an “interesting case study” to see how US-China relations had fared in recent times, compared with developments along the China-India border.

;

;“China has gone to the extent of snapping the dialogue between the Chinese defence minister and the US defence secretary. So, viewed in that comparative prism, there is reason for some optimism that India-China talks have not ruptured,” he said.

;An inspection of 47 ageing buildings in Hong Kong has found more than half are at “immediate risk” from various defects, with a lawmaker reporting the problems to authorities amid a spate of cases of concrete chunks landing on vehicles and roads.

;

;The Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong (DAB) and the Hong Kong Institution of Building Inspectors (HKIBI) on Monday urged authorities to improve the city's existing maintenance procedures to tackle “ticking bombs” in the community.

;

;“What we are going to do is that we are going to notify certain departments and hope that they can do the maintenance as soon as possible,” said Edward Leung Hei, a lawmaker for Island East.

;

;'30 Hong Kong buildings to undergo emergency repairs' after falling concrete cases

;

;“We also want to ask if residents see any of the defects we mentioned, please tell us … if there is an immediate risk, we will tell the government, so we can defuse these 'bombs' in the community,” he added.

;

;As part of the joint report, both groups identified 47 buildings in the Eastern district of Hong Kong Island that fell under the government's inspection requirement.

;

;Each structure has been categorised as “three-nil”, meaning they lack any owners' corporations, or residents' groups or were not maintained by property management companies.

;

;The researchers adopted what they called “a rapid inspection” methodology by using drones and an infrared thermal scanner to uncover 25 buildings with defects that are categorised as posing “immediate risks”.

;

;The most common issues found by the two groups were building finishes that could fall off and cracks, as well as rust and water stains.

;

;A building on 123 Wan Chai Road was listed as an example in the report, with the structure featuring a concrete platform with signs of curvature and structural damage.

;

;But the DAB and HKIBI stopped short of revealing the addresses of other potentially dangerous buildings, saying such information could stoke unnecessary concerns among the public.

;

;The Post has contacted the Building's Department and the Development Bureau for comment.

;

;HKIBI founding president Tony Yu lik-sang advocated the use of a “Rapid Infrared Thermographic Survey” and explained that the process involved using thermal scanners to detect temperature differences and potentially identify “water trapped inside” buildings that could affect their structural integrity.

;

;Warning for 'obstinate' Hong Kong building owners to ensure work orders followed

;

;Inspectors would visit the site to identify the defects after the initial thermal sweep, he said, but stressed the process was a quick review of structure safety for high-risk buildings and no substitute for a full-on check by a registered building inspector.

;

;However, Vincent Ho Kui-yip, building policy panel chairman for the Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors, argued that infrared scans were not foolproof and building owners should take responsibility for safety checks.

;

;He noted that infrared scanners could only detect differences in temperatures on a building's surface, adding that heat generated by air conditioners could paint a misleading picture.

;

;“The government can only identify and settle those buildings with obvious risks as other buildings will still age after typhoons and rainfalls,” he said. “Owners have to conduct inspections.”

;

;Falling concrete chunk in Hong Kong rips hole in roof of double-decker bus

;

;Hong Kong has recorded at least 18 incidents of concrete and debris falling from buildings since July, with some instances leading to pedestrians being injured or damaging vehicles.

;

;Secretary for Development Bernadette Linn Hon-ho earlier said there were 900 buildings which had failed to comply with mandatory inspection orders, 30 of which would undergo emergency repairs by the Buildings Department after they used drones to complete preliminary checks.

;

;The minister had also said the department would conduct maintenance works for another 1,100 ageing buildings. About 400 were undergoing inspections, while the remainder were undergoing repairs, she added.

;Torrential rain in India's Himalayas triggered landslides over the weekend that have killed at least 41 people, with over a dozen trapped or missing, officials said on Monday.

;

;Unusually heavy rain and melting glaciers have brought deadly flash floods to the mountains of India and neighbouring Pakistan and Nepal over the past year or two, with government officials increasingly blaming climate change.

;“Reports of cloudbursts and landslides have emerged from various parts of the state resulting in loss of precious lives and property.”

;At least 41 people have died in rain-related incidents since Sunday and 13 were still missing, according to a report by the state disaster management department, seen by Reuters.

;

;In one the most deadly incidents, a temple collapsed in the state capital, Shimla, with rescuers pulling out at least nine bodies, the chief minister said.

;

;Television footage showed swollen rivers breaking their banks in Himachal and neighbouring Uttarakhand state, where record rains have also damaged roads and infrastructure.

;

;The India Meteorological Department issued a “red alert” for both Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand on Monday and has forecast rainfall intensity to reduce Tuesday onwards.

;

;Parts of Himachal and Uttarakhand received as much as 273mm and 419mm of rain in 24 hours until 8.30am IST on Monday, the weather office said.

;

;Schools and other educational institutes have been ordered to close in Himachal Pradesh and people in danger were being moved to safety in shelters, state officials said.

;

;Uttarakhand state authorities announced the Char Dham pilgrimage route would be closed till Tuesday after landslides.

;

;“This is the first time we're seeing multiple cloudburst incidents and widespread damage in Himachal Pradesh,” said state disaster management official Praveen Bhardwaj.

;

;In Solan district, houses collapsed, killing at least seven people, and a mother and her child were killed in Mandi district when their house collapsed, Bhardwaj said.
